tn.ref: These were the descendants of Esau (also called Edom)
tn.text: "These are the descendants of Esau, who is also called Edom." This sentence introduces the account of Esau's descendants in Genesis 36:1-8. AT: "This is an account of the descendants of Esau, who is also called Edom." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
These are names of Esau's wives. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

"Elon the descendant of Heth" or "Elon a descendant of Heth." This is the name of a man. See how you translate this in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:26:34|26:34]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This refers to a larger group of people. See how you translated it in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:10:15|10:17]].
This is the name of one of Esau's wives. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:26:34|26:34]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of one of Ishmael's sons. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:28:08|28:9]].  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of Esau's wives. See how you translated these in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:01|36:2-3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of Esau's sons. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: which he had gathered in the land of Canaan
tn.text: This refers to all of the things that he had accumulated while living in the land of Canaan. AT: "which he had accumulated while living in the land of Canaan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This means to moved to another place and live there. AT: "went to live in another land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"Esau's and Jacob's possessions"

tn.ref: could not support them because of their livestock
tn.text: The land was not large enough to support all of the livestock that Jacob and Esau owned. AT: "was not big enough to support all of their livestock" or "was not big enough for both Esau's flocks and Jacob's flocks" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The word "settled" means to move somewhere and live there. AT: "where they had moved to" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: These were the descendants of Esau
tn.text: This sentence introduces the account of Esau's descendants in Genesis 36:9-43. AT: "This is an account of the descendants of Esau" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: in the hill country of Seir
tn.text: This means that they lived in the hill country of Seir. The full meaning of this may be made explicit. AT: "who lived in the hill country of Seir" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
These are names of Esau's sons. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:04|36:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of Esau's wives. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:01|36:2-3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz ... Amalek
tn.text: These are names of the sons of Eliphaz. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of Eliphaz's concubine. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of Esau's sons. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:04|36:4-5]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of Reuel's sons. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of Esau's wives. See how you translated these in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:01|36:2-3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of one of Esau's sons. See how you translated his name in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:04|36:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Kenaz, Korah, Gatam, and Amalek
tn.text: These are names of Eliphaz's sons. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of one of Esau's wives. See how you translated her name in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:01|36:2-3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of Esau's sons. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:04|36:4-5]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of Reuel's sons. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:13|36:13]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This means that they lived in the land of Edom. AT: "who lived in the land of Edom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
These are the names of Esau's wives. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:01|36:2-3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This the name of a man. See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:01|36:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The word "Seir" is the name of a man and of a country.
The word "Horite" refers to a people group. See how you translated it in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:14:03|14:6]].
"who lived in the land of Seir, which is also called Edom"

tn.ref: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan ... Hori and Heman
tn.text: These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a woman. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of men. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:20|36:20]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam ... Aiah and Anah
tn.text: These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of men. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:20|36:20-21]].
This is the name of a woman. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Keran ... Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan ... Uz and Aran
tn.text: These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a people group. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:14:03|14:6]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, and Anah, Dishon, Ezer, Dishan
tn.text: These are the names of men. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:20|36:20-21]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This means that they lived in the land of Seir. AT: "of those who lived in the land of Seir" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This means that this was the city where he lived. AT: "the name of the city where he lived" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
These are names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a man. See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:31|36:33]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Husham who was of the land of the Temanites
tn.text: This means that Husham lived in the land of the Temanites. AT: "Husham who lived in the land of the Temanites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
These are names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"the descendants of Teman" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This means that this was the city where he lived. AT: "The name of the city where he lived" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"Samlah from Masrekah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a man. See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:36:34|36:36]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: then Shaul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his place
tn.text: Shaul lived in Rehoboth. Rehoboth was by the Euphrates river. This information can be made clear. AT: "then Shaul reigned in his place. He was from Rehoboth which is by the Euphrates River" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Shaul ... Baal Hanan ... Achbor ... Hadar ... Matred ... Me Zahab
tn.text: These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This means that this was the city where he lived. AT: "The name of the city where he lived" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: the daughter of Matred, the granddaughter of Me Zahab
tn.text: The missing information can be added. AT: "she was the daughter of Matred, and the granddaughter of Me Zahab" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is the name of a woman. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"the leaders of the clans"

tn.ref: according to their clans and their regions, by their names
tn.text: The clans and the regions were named after the heads of the clans. See the UDB for a clearer translation. AT: "the name of their clans and the regions where they lived were named after them. These are their names:" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Timna, Alvah, Jetheth, Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon, Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar, Magdiel, and Iram
tn.text: These are names of people groups. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"dwelling places" or "the places they lived"
This list is said "to be" Esau, which means that it is the whole list of his descendants. AT: "This is the list of the descendants of Esau" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
